http://www.fogcreek.com/kiln/features/code-reviews.html
Ben McKenzie

event.s:
I am not sure who setup the mirroring. I was told about it by Cheng. I think it was a project he was working on originally.
Scott
Hey Scott, Do you know who set this up, and when? I can't seem to find much documentation about it. What is the purpose of using the mirror? If this is strictly a performance reason, I would like you to know that we are working with fog creek to increase the performance and stability of Fogbugz and kiln with both hardware and software updates. Thanks, Keith
We used to use a hg mirror for our build server to pull changesets from. A while ago it stopped working and we had to switch back to the Kiln server. I checked again today and it still looks like it is not updating. You can still see that no CCC changes have been pulled in for 8 weeks.: http://kiln-mirror.devid.local/kiln/Code/CCC/Development/CCC/
event.sHtml:
I am not sure who setup the mirroring.  I was told about it by Cheng.  I think it was a project he was working on originally.

Scott

Hey Scott,
Do you know who set this up, and when? I can't seem to find much documentation about it. What is the purpose of using the mirror? If this is strictly a performance reason, I would like you to know that we are working with fog creek to increase the performance and stability of Fogbugz and kiln with both hardware and software updates.
Thanks,
Keith

We used to use a hg mirror for our build server to pull changesets from.  A while ago it stopped working and we had to switch back to the Kiln server.  I checked again today and it still looks like it is not updating.  You can still see that no CCC changes have been pulled in for 8 weeks.:
http://kiln-mirror.devid.local/kiln/Code/CCC/Development/CCC/

case.sLatestTextSummary: Per my conversation with Ammad, I am requesting a new app server to be built on 16.x network to work with the R&D DB server 16.42. It will be running Java apps for perform analysis and mining on the R&D data. It does not need to be huge since ...

event.s:
Per my conversation with Ammad,
I am requesting a new app server to be built on 16.x network to work with the R&D DB server 16.42. It will be running Java apps for perform analysis and mining on the R&D data. It does not need to be huge since only 2 -3 people at most will be working on it at the same time. The JVM needs large memory (16GB min, 24GB preferred) to handle the large data the mining engine will pull for analysis.
64bit windows OS SQL Server 2008 R2 Developer version
I can install other apps
Thanks,
Charles
event.sHtml:
Per my conversation with Ammad,
 
I am requesting a new app server to be built on 16.x network to work with the R&D DB server 16.42.  It will be running Java apps for perform analysis and mining on the R&D data.  It does not need to be huge since only 2 -3 people at most will be working on it at the same time.  The JVM needs large memory (16GB min, 24GB preferred) to handle the large data the mining engine will pull for analysis. 
 
64bit windows OS
SQL Server 2008 R2 Developer version
 
I can install other apps
 
Thanks,
 
Charles

case.sTitle: FogBugz: Filter assignment is sharing when it shouldn't

event.s:
From: "McKenzie, Ben" <McKenziB@advisory.com> Subject: Filters assigned to wrong project Date: September 12, 2012 3:24:15 PM CDT To: "Zhou, Cheng" <ZhouC@advisory.com>, "Diedrick, Scott" <DiedricS@advisory.com> Cc: "Jilani, Ammad" <JilaniA@advisory.com>
There seem to be a few shared filters incorrectly showing up as assigned to the CMA project. Is there any way for us to remove/assign them to the correct project?
Some examples are "CCI.2012.02.Issues", "My cases (test)", "Bug Resolution Time By Milestone" - queries CDA.
event.sHtml:
From: "McKenzie, Ben" <McKenziB@advisory.com>
Subject: Filters assigned to wrong project
Date: September 12, 2012 3:24:15 PM CDT
To: "Zhou, Cheng" <ZhouC@advisory.com>, "Diedrick, Scott" <DiedricS@advisory.com>
Cc: "Jilani, Ammad" <JilaniA@advisory.com>

There seem to be a few shared filters incorrectly showing up as assigned to the CMA project.  Is there any way for us to remove/assign them to the correct project?

Some examples are "CCI.2012.02.Issues", "My cases (test)", "Bug Resolution Time By Milestone" - queries CDA.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Keith Chirco (PA) by Ammad Admin (PA)

event.s:
I played with this for a little bit. If you look at one of these filters (cases by developer), it shows that it's for a specific project. So should only show for people who have that project.
If I disable the shared filter it disappears for everyone. But not all the shared filters are doing this.
event.sHtml:
I played with this for a little bit.  If you look at one of these filters (cases by developer), it shows that it's for a specific project.  So should only show for people who have that project.

If I disable the shared filter it disappears for everyone.  But not all the shared filters are doing this.

event.s: Request: Setup a Terminal Server Purpose: Provide Windows Terminal Server ability to everyone Priority: normal Server name: eyeball.devid.local IP: Use a temp ip then replace it with the CCC-Dev-View ip OS: Windows Server 2008r2 # of CPU's: 8 Amount of Memory: 64GB Disk Space: 2 drives: 200 for OS and SWAP; 300 (?) for USER files. event.sHtml:
Request: Setup a Terminal Server
Purpose: Provide Windows Terminal Server ability to everyone
Priority: normal
Server name: eyeball.devid.local
IP: Use a temp ip then replace it with the CCC-Dev-View ip
OS: Windows Server 2008r2
# of CPU's: 8
Amount of Memory: 64GB
Disk Space: 2 drives: 200 for OS and SWAP; 300 (?) for USER files.  We'll have to figure out how to move the user directory so if a user makes files they don't go to OS drive.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Please make sure to let Brock know before you swap out \BuildArtifacts from pointing from C:\ to a new D:\ 1) Child ticket to clean up .16.58 first 2) Make a 500gb drive, D:\ 3) We'll have to stop Site Manager 4) move files from C:\ and E:\ to ...

event.s:
Please make sure to let Brock know before you swap out \BuildArtifacts from pointing from C:\ to a new D:\
1) Child ticket to clean up .16.58 first 2) Make a 500gb drive, D:\ 3) We'll have to stop Site Manager 4) move files from C:\ and E:\ to D:\ so Sitemanager works 5) Setup share: \BuildArtifacts to point to new drive space
Please do 3-5 with Brock
************************************ Email from Brock:
Yes, E:\ would work totally fine. Or maybe would could even make a separate local drive just for build artifacts. Whatever you guys think is best.
The end requirements are: - 500 GB of space available for build artifacts - All build artifacts exposed as \\192.168.16.58\BuildArtifacts
Thanks, Brock
event.sHtml:
Please make sure to let Brock know before you swap out \BuildArtifacts from pointing from C:\ to a new D:\

1) Child ticket to clean up .16.58 first
2) Make a 500gb drive, D:\
3) We'll have to stop Site Manager
4) move files from C:\ and E:\ to D:\ so Sitemanager works
5) Setup share: \BuildArtifacts to point to new drive space

Please do 3-5 with Brock

************************************
Email from Brock:

Yes, E:\ would work totally fine.  Or maybe would could even make a separate local drive just for build artifacts. Whatever you guys think is best.
 
The end requirements are:
-          500 GB of space available for build artifacts
-          All build artifacts exposed as \\192.168.16.58\BuildArtifacts
 
Thanks,
Brock

case.sLatestTextSummary: We'll run some diagnostics during the maintenance window this weekend (starting tonight)...more updates to follow.

event.s:
Matt heard a little about this already.
Martin and I would like to request that while you & your team are doing your monthly maintenance that you pay special attention to esxi4.devid.local and do some extensive memory testing. We infrequently get a BSOD with event ID 1005, qualifier 16384. Some googling indicates that this is a rare problem on servers that run a lot of virtual machines. The problem in the few cases available is usually corrupt physical RAM. Here are some references if you would like to read up on the problem.
See http://www.google.com/#hl=en&sclient=psy-ab&q=event+id+1005+qualifiers+16384&oq=event+id+1005+qualifiers+16384&gs_l=serp.3...6091.6091.1.7016.1.1.0.0.0.0.84.84.1.1.0.les%3B..0.0...1c.1.aCSO3p3iRA8&pbx=1&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.r_qf.&fp=3dc95e9e4b11f48e&biw=1920&bih=947
And http://www.google.com/#hl=en&sugexp=les%3B&gs_nf=1&gs_mss=event%20id%206008%20windows%202&pq=event%20id%206008&cp=26&gs_id=1g&xhr=t&q=event+id+6008+windows+2008&pf=p&sclient=psy-ab&oq=event+id+6008+windows+2008&gs_l=&pbx=1&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.r_qf.&fp=3dc95e9e4b11f48e&biw=1920&bih=947
event.sHtml:
Matt heard a little about this already.
 
Martin and I would like to request that while you & your team are doing your monthly maintenance that you pay special attention to esxi4.devid.local and do some extensive memory testing.  We infrequently get a BSOD with event ID 1005, qualifier 16384.  Some googling indicates that this is a rare problem on servers that run a lot of virtual machines.  The problem in the few cases available is usually corrupt physical RAM.
Here are some references if you would like to read up on the problem.
 
See
http://www.google.com/#hl=en&sclient=psy-ab&q=event+id+1005+qualifiers+16384&oq=event+id+1005+qualifiers+16384&gs_l=serp.3...6091.6091.1.7016.1.1.0.0.0.0.84.84.1.1.0.les%3B..0.0...1c.1.aCSO3p3iRA8&pbx=1&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.r_qf.&fp=3dc95e9e4b11f48e&biw=1920&bih=947
 
And
http://www.google.com/#hl=en&sugexp=les%3B&gs_nf=1&gs_mss=event%20id%206008%20windows%202&pq=event%20id%206008&cp=26&gs_id=1g&xhr=t&q=event+id+6008+windows+2008&pf=p&sclient=psy-ab&oq=event+id+6008+windows+2008&gs_l=&pbx=1&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.r_qf.&fp=3dc95e9e4b11f48e&biw=1920&bih=947

case.sLatestTextSummary: Brock, Closing ticket since Scott has left the company and dotCover shows up in the JetBrains License Server. -- FogBugz devops@advisory.com --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Powered by FogBugz from ...

event.s:
Hi Keith/Ammad/Cheng, We have a JetBrains license server that all of the teams use for our dotTrace license and ReSharper licenses. Is this something you guys would own, or developers should continue to own? Feels like the former would be most appropriate to me. I installed the server originally and would be happy to explain the setup to you. Let me know what you’re thinking. Thanks, Brock
From: Bouchard, Brock Sent: Monday, July 09, 2012 1:43 PM To: Gupta, Rekha; Zhu, Zheng; Diedrick, Scott Cc: crimsondevit@crimsonservices.com Subject: RE: DotTrace License Server
Nobody officially maintains it yet. I set it up. In theory one of you guys could just upgrade it. However, we do have a new guy named Keith in charge of the dev infrastructure. If you email crimsondevit@crimsonservices.com with a request to upgrade, it could be a good opportunity to transfer ownership away from us and to our IT team. - Brock
From: Gupta, Rekha Sent: Monday, July 09, 2012 12:02 PM To: Bouchard, Brock; Zhu, Zheng; Diedrick, Scott Subject: RE: DotTrace License Server
Scot tried to get dotCover licenses set up on license server and he thinks we might have to upgrade the server for dotCover option to show up. Who maintains these servers, who should request be sent to?

event.s:
From: "McKenzie, Ben" <McKenziB@advisory.com> Date: Mon, 5 Nov 2012 22:44:19 -0600 To: "iDevOps" <iDevOps@advisory.com> Cc: "DevOps" <DevOps@advisory.com>, "Wong, Beemer" <WongBe@advisory.com>, "Gunaraj, Prabu" <GunarajP@advisory.com>, "Jilani, Ammad" <JilaniA@advisory.com> Subject: Additional space on 16.92 I'd like to request additional space on 192.168.16.92, which is our build server. We currently have 100GB of space total on that machine, which is not enough to handle our build needs, and would like to request an additional 200GB. If it cannot be added to the existing drive and instead needs to be new drive, I would prefer at least 250 GB for a new drive (due to the fact that we'll need to move approximately 50GB of data off the old one).
Ben McKenzie
Software Development Manager, Performance Technologies
The Advisory Board Company
512-681-2220 direct | 202-266-5700 fax
mckenzib@advisory.com <mailto:mckenzib@advisory.com> | www.advisory.com <http://www.advisory.com/>
event.sBodyText:
I'd like to request additional space on 192.168.16.92, which is our build server. We currently have 100GB of space total on that machine, which is not enough to handle our build needs, and would like to request an additional 200GB. If it cannot be added to the existing drive and instead needs to be new drive, I would prefer at least 250 GB for a new drive (due to the fact that we'll need to move approximately 50GB of data off the old one).
Ben McKenzie
Software Development Manager, Performance Technologies
The Advisory Board Company
512-681-2220 direct | 202-266-5700 fax
mckenzib@advisory.com <mailto:mckenzib@advisory.com> | www.advisory.com <http://www.advisory.com/>
event.sBodyHTML:
I'd like to request additional space on 192.168.16.92, which is our build server.  We currently have 100GB of space total on that machine, which is not enough to handle our build needs, and would like to request an additional 200GB.  If it cannot be added to the existing drive and instead needs to be new drive, I would prefer at least 250 GB for a new drive (due to the fact that we'll need to move approximately 50GB of data off the old one).

Ben McKenzie

Software Development Manager, Performance Technologies

The Advisory Board Company

512-681-2220 direct | 202-266-5700 fax

mckenzib@advisory.com <mailto:mckenzib@advisory.com> | www.advisory.com <http://www.advisory.com/>

Ammad

Whom do I need to add to it for >> access? >> >> Specs >> Name: CMA-RND-DB01 >> CPU: 8 >> Memory: 32GB >> OS Disk: 100gb (C Drive) >> Swap Disk: 100gb (D Drive) >> Data Disk: 4TB (E Drive) >> >> Please make sure that any data goes on Drive E. >> >> Ammad >

Matt/Keith,

case.sLatestTextSummary: fixed by removing duplicate error emitter events (was causing loop)
case.sTitle: fix recurring request / parse loop for when kiln breaks

event.s:
sometimes kiln craps out and instead of rejecting the request the api sends you to their 404 not found page , which instead of returning json returns html markup. this caused all sorts of nasty in the parser pipe, so i had to write special case for looping after a delay until kiln worked again
had to modify the json parsers as well, hence why they are in lib
event.sHtml:
sometimes kiln craps out and instead of rejecting the request the api sends you to their 404 not found page , which instead of returning json returns html markup.  this caused all sorts of nasty in the parser pipe, so i had to write special case for looping after a delay until kiln worked again

had to modify the json parsers as well, hence why they are in lib

case.sLatestTextSummary: ability to grab only newer information, so not pulling the entire db over and over again i will start with detecting most recent changesets, all this entails is counting the existing changesets associated with the particular repo this is dependent ...
case.sTitle: ability to pull only latest changes

event.s:
ability to grab only newer information, so not pulling the entire db over and over again
i will start with detecting most recent changesets, all this entails is counting the existing changesets associated with the particular repo
this is dependent on
1) storing repos 2) storing changesets 3) associating them 4) counting the changesets per repo
event.sHtml:
ability to grab only newer information, so not pulling the entire db over and over again

i will start with detecting most recent changesets, all this entails is counting the existing changesets associated with the particular repo

this is dependent on

1) storing repos
2) storing changesets
3) associating them
4) counting the changesets per repo

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brandon Selway by Brandon Selway

case.sLatestTextSummary: Actively working on this. Original Plan was: _____________________________________________________ 1) Platform: CommonAuthentication Dev App Server Doesn't Exist? Dev DB Server Doesn't Exist? Dev Build Server Doesn't Exist? QA App Server ...
case.sTitle: Server: Platform Build and App server

event.s:
Request for servers: Platform teams needs a build server and app server pair.
They should have: 1) Crimson Authentication Library: They should have a pair for App+DB, they don't need heavy sizing. QA should have App+DB.
2) All other platform initiatives: share an App+DB; QA should have an App+DB
3) They can share a single build server.
4) You'll have to rename the server in QA.
event.sHtml:
Request for servers: Platform teams needs a build server and app server pair.

They should have:
1) Crimson Authentication Library: They should have a pair for App+DB, they don't need heavy sizing.  QA should have App+DB.

2) All other platform initiatives: share an App+DB; QA should have an App+DB

3) They can share a single build server.

4) You'll have to rename the server in QA.

case.sLatestTextSummary: We need to be able to take a static JSON / etc file that is MOCK fogbugz data, pass it through subscriptions.js and output reliable data every time. 1) generate mock test data set 2) create a process that pushes this through subscriptions.js ...
case.sTitle: process mock fogbugz data from predefined dataset into output

event.s:
We need to be able to take a static JSON / etc file that is MOCK fogbugz data, pass it through subscriptions.js and output reliable data every time.
1) generate mock test data set 2) create a process that pushes this through subscriptions.js (as if live data) 3) compare test output to results data set 4) encapsulate all of this with a test runner
event.sHtml:
We need to be able to take a static JSON / etc file that is MOCK fogbugz data, pass it through  subscriptions.js  and output reliable data every time.

1)  generate mock test data set
2)  create a process that pushes this through subscriptions.js (as if live data)
3)  compare test output to results data set
4)  encapsulate all of this with a test runner

case.sLatestTextSummary: streams and pipes FTW! this will be a much better way to handle async can define the pipe structure in a separate controller file and then simply juggle / process the streams also will pave the way to easily be able to LOG, BACKUP, output the ...
case.sTitle: create new control structure utilizing streams and pipes

event.s:
streams and pipes FTW!
this will be a much better way to handle async
can define the pipe structure in a separate controller file
and then simply juggle / process the streams
also will pave the way to easily be able to LOG, BACKUP, output the streams to different formats, decouple the DB, decouple the ticket system, STREAM STRAIGHT FROM THE DB TO THE BROWSER
ETC
basically, its what makes node awesome.
event.sHtml:

case.sLatestTextSummary: currently sync.js is dumping bunches of raw json objects into log files, but not comma separated or contained in any way -- ie not consumable. this can be fixed. (JSONStream, I believe even has a stream to JSON option) also would like to stream ...
case.sTitle: dump/consume raw data in applicable formats (for logging, testing etc)

event.s:
currently sync.js is dumping bunches of raw json objects into log files, but not comma separated or contained in any way -- ie not consumable. this can be fixed. (JSONStream, I believe even has a stream to JSON option)
also would like to stream the raw request output to disk. so
1) stream a bunch of individual js objects turned into an array in log file 2) raw request returned (from api)
*the thought is to be able to flip a switch and now we're using local data instead of the slow api*
also great for testing (test for consistent results based on a static set of data)
event.sHtml:
currently sync.js is dumping bunches of raw json objects into log files, but not comma separated or contained in any way -- ie not consumable.  this can be fixed.  (JSONStream, I believe even has a stream to JSON option)

also would like to stream the raw request output to disk.
so

1) stream a bunch of individual js objects turned into an array in log file
2) raw request returned (from api)

*the thought is to be able to flip a switch and now we're using local data instead of the slow api*

also great for testing (test for consistent results based on a static set of data)

case.sTitle: Security Scan: Implement Software Security Scanning

event.s:
Requested by Curt Berry on Jun 22, 2012 11:01 AM Due Date : Jun 23, 2012 11:00 AM Subject Proj: Security Scan: Implement Software Security Scan Solution Description Conversations New Problem Associate Change Jilani, Ammad To: Berry, Curt‎; Chirco, Keith Friday, June 22, 2012 10:54 AM You replied on 6/22/2012 10:57 AM.
Yeah, let's chat next week.
Keith, can you please add this as task item and bug me on it first thing next week. I'd like for this to be something DevOps sets up for everyone.
Ammad
On Jun 22, 2012, at 10:32 AM, Berry, Curt wrote:
I watched a couple of the online demos (had to register my email address). Someone from the company called me, and we chatted this morning on my way into the office.
I see pros and cons, would be interested in your thoughts:
PRO: Uploading the debug EXE/DLLs to them does allow them to test all of the included 3rd packages. So, if anyone uses a 3rd-party tool, it can catch problems with that. I’m interested to see how detailed their analysis is…meaning, can they get down to the line of code and say, “fix this line because of this reason”, etc…
CON: When I used Fortify in the past, it ran locally as a plugin, and you (as a developer) could run it as much as you wanted. For me, I ran it at the end of each day of development, and would then come back an address any issues. Obviously, as time went by, that became less and less as I learned the patterns to watch out for. I didn’t get the impression from talking to the guy this morning that the integration is that seamless.
I’d be interested to hear your thoughts on the matter..
Thanks,
Curt Berry Development Manager, Crimson Data Acquisition (CDA) The Advisory Board Company | Performance Technologies 512-681-2170 direct | 202-266-5700 fax berrycu@advisory.com | www.advisory.com
Jilani, Ammad Thursday, June 21, 2012 6:50 PM DevOps will work with Prod team and Security to get this setup for everyone.
ammad
On Jun 21, 2012, at 5:08 PM, Guevara, Luis wrote:
All teams will be required to use Veracode after the pilot with CPRM is complete. This is a DC security project that should be completed in the next couple months.
From: Ahmed, Faqir Sent: Thursday, June 21, 2012 5:04 PM To: Spinnler, Alexander; Berry, Curt Cc: Crimson Dev Leaders Subject: Re: Software Security scans
We are starting to use veracode in CRT and CPRM.
Also, Luis ran a security scan a while ago on CPRM, but I don't remember the name of that tool.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Faqir Ahmed Development Director, Performance Technologies The Advisory Board Company 512-609-1188 direct | 202-266-5700 fax ahmedf@advisory.com | www.advisory.com
Now Open: Health Care Advisory Board 2011-2012 National Meeting Series Beyond the ACO: Moving past regulatory uncertainty to deliver on the promise of accountable care Register Now <http://advbd.co/rp7ajF>
From: "Spinnler, Alexander" <SpinnleA@advisory.com> Date: Thu, 21 Jun 2012 18:02:35 -0400 To: "Berry, Curt" <BerryCu@advisory.com> Cc: Crimson Dev Leaders <CrimsonDevLeaders@advisory.com> Subject: Re: Software Security scans
Curt-
CPM team is not doing anything like this and I'm 95% sure none of other teams are either. Will let them weigh in.
Alex
On Jun 21, 2012, at 4:46 PM, Berry, Curt wrote:
Crimson Dev,
Do any of the teams currently use any 3rd-party software that scans source solutions looking for vulnerabilities in code? At my previous job, we used Fortify Visual Studio plugin:
https://www.fortify.com/products/hpfssc/source-code-analyzer.html
It would scan your source code and identify security holes, such as cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities and clear-text passwords. It ranked issues in a .NET project by order of priority, and with each issue, provided links on what it takes to remediate the problem.
I’d like to have CDA code run through the same type of scans before we release to QA each cycle, and was curious if any of the other Crimson teams were using similar technology for the scans?
Thanks,
Curt Berry Development Manager, Crimson Data Acquisition (CDA) The Advisory Board Company | Performance Technologies 512-681-2170 direct | 202-266-5700 fax berrycu@advisory.com | www.advisory.com

On Jun 22, 2012, at 10:32 AM, Berry, Curt wrote:

I watched a couple of the online demos (had to register my email address).  Someone from the company called me, and we chatted this morning on my way into the office.
 
I see pros and cons, would be interested in your thoughts:
 
PRO:
Uploading the debug EXE/DLLs to them does allow them to test all of the included 3rd packages.  So, if anyone uses a 3rd-party tool, it can catch problems with that.  I’m interested to see how detailed their analysis is…meaning, can they get down to the line of code and say, “fix this line because of this reason”, etc…
 
CON:
When I used Fortify in the past, it ran locally as a plugin, and you (as a developer) could run it as much as you wanted.  For me, I ran it at the end of each day of development, and would then come back an address any issues.  Obviously, as time went by, that became less and less as I learned the patterns to watch out for.  I didn’t get the impression from talking to the guy this morning that the integration is that seamless.
 
I’d be interested to hear your thoughts on the matter..
 
Thanks,
 
Curt Berry

case.sTitle: Kiln: getbundle got unexpected arguments kbfiles

event.s:
D:\work\CoreTrack>hg push pushing to https://fogbugz.devid.local/kiln/Code/CCC/Development/CoreTrack searching for changes remote: kiln: successfully pushed 2 changesets remote: abort: getbundle got unexpected arguments kbfiles
I’ve noticed this error quite a few times now. It doesn’t seem to have any impact, but is a bit alarming. I know we’ve made some changes according to the recommendations around commenting out the kbfiles. Is this a known issue?
Zheng Zhu, PMP
event.sHtml:

pushing to https://fogbugz.devid.local/kiln/Code/CCC/Development/CoreTrack

I’ve noticed this error quite a few times now.  It doesn’t seem to have any impact, but is a bit alarming.
I know we’ve made some changes according to the recommendations around commenting out the kbfiles.
Is this a known issue?
 
Zheng Zhu, PMP

[extensions]

progress=
color=
[auth]

kiln.username=zzhu
kiln.password=

[tortoisehg]
issue.regex=(?i)(?:(review|case|bug[zs]?\s*(id)?:?)s?\s*[#:; ]+)(([ ,:;#]*)(?P<bugid>\d+))
issue.link=https://fogbugz.devid.local/?{3}

case.sLatestTextSummary: The most recent 6 milestones picked by default to graph seems to make less sense to include those milestones defined as future releases. Project managers may need milestones defined ahead of time for planning purpose. But picking them for graph ...
case.sTitle: Default picks of most recent milestones should NOT include future milestones

event.s: The most recent 6 milestones picked by default to graph seems to make less sense to include those milestones defined as future releases. Project managers may need milestones defined ahead of time for planning purpose. But picking them for graph makes no sense. It would be great if we could add some logic to include only those milestones that have finished already (end date is in the past comparing with current date). I understand user can pick and choose milestones to graph, but the right default picks will improve the usability quite bit.
event.sHtml: The most recent 6 milestones picked by default to graph seems to make less sense to include those milestones defined as future releases. Project managers may need milestones defined ahead of time for planning purpose. But picking them for graph makes no sense. It would be great if we could add some logic to include only those milestones that have finished already (end date is in the past comparing with current date).  I understand user can pick and choose milestones to graph, but the right default picks will improve the usability quite bit.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Rahul Bhansali by Ethan Winters

event.s:
The :openTicket tag is not a valid tag. It is never set by the subscription, so instead of relying on that, I did the same thing the interface does, which is look at the status and separate items based upon the status.
The other alternative would be to make the subscription actually set that value, but that seems to be not the way it was designed and would greatly increase the size of the databse.
Testing Instructions:
Run app, check top numbers for open and closed tickets for a milestone. They should match using "All Cases" (not that if you filter to other sets, the numbers won't necessarily match because the top counts are for everything, unfiltered).
event.sChanges: Developer changed from Rahul Bhansali to Benjamin McKenzie Status changed from 'New' to 'Resolved (Needs Review)'.
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Cheng Zhou by Benjamin McKenzie
event.sHtml:
The :openTicket tag is not a valid tag.  It is never set by the subscription, so instead of relying on that, I did the same thing the interface does, which is look at the status and separate items based upon the status.

The other alternative would be to make the subscription actually set that value, but that seems to be not the way it was designed and would greatly increase the size of the databse.

 

Testing Instructions:

  1. Run app, check top numbers for open and closed tickets for a milestone.  They should match using "All Cases" (not that if you filter to other sets, the numbers won't necessarily match because the top counts are for everything, unfiltered).

case.sLatestTextSummary: I found some more info after digging around: http://www.sqlmag.com/article/sql-server-2012/sql-server-2012-editions-142261 So going with Enterprise Edition. However, we're very limited on CPU and Memory until we get some upgrades and a memory ...

event.s:
I found some more info after digging around: http://www.sqlmag.com/article/sql-server-2012/sql-server-2012-editions-142261
So going with Enterprise Edition. However, we're very limited on CPU and Memory until we get some upgrades and a memory order in. So this may need to wait two weeks.
Moving this ticket to FB
a
************************************************
Sanjay, Beemer, P,
Including Luis as this will effect them in 2013.
Which version of SQL Server 2012? I'm looking at MSDN, I see the following 11 choices. I've not been able to match this list to any of the SQL Server comparison pages at Microsoft.com.
Thoughts?
SQL Server 2012 Business Intelligence (x86 and x64) - DVD (English) SQL Server 2012 Developer Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English) SQL Server 2012 Enterprise Core Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English) SQL Server 2012 Enterprise Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English) SQL Server 2012 Standard Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English) SQL Server 2012 Web Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English) SQL Server 2012 SQLLocalDB (x64) - (English)
I don't think it's one of these: SQL Server 2012 Express Management Studio (x64) - (English) SQL Server 2012 Express Edition with Tools (x64) - (English) SQL Server 2012 Express Edition with Advanced Services (x64) - (English) SQL Server 2012 Express (x64) - (English)
Ammad
Category : Description : Hi
As a part of a CMA Strategy project we are going to compare SQL query performance in SQL Server 2008 and in SQL Server 2012.
I would require two Vms of the same configuration except that VM1 should have SQL Server 2008 and the other one should have SQL Server 2012. This will help us compare our loaders or SQL operations apples to apples.
Please let me know if there is any specific process for requesting such Vms other than e-mail and I would be more than happy to do so.
Thanks S.Sanjay --
event.sHtml:
I found some more info after digging around:
http://www.sqlmag.com/article/sql-server-2012/sql-server-2012-editions-142261

So going with Enterprise Edition.  However, we're very limited on CPU and Memory until we get some upgrades and a memory order in.  So this may need to wait two weeks.

Moving this ticket to FB

a

************************************************

Sanjay, Beemer, P,

Including Luis as this will effect them in 2013.

Which version of SQL Server 2012?  I'm looking at MSDN, I see the following 11 choices.  I've not been able to match this list to any of the SQL Server comparison pages at Microsoft.com.

Thoughts?

SQL Server 2012 Business Intelligence (x86 and x64) - DVD (English)
SQL Server 2012 Developer Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English)
SQL Server 2012 Enterprise Core Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English)
SQL Server 2012 Enterprise Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English)
SQL Server 2012 Standard Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English)
SQL Server 2012 Web Edition (x86 and x64) - DVD (English)
SQL Server 2012 SQLLocalDB (x64) - (English)

I don't think it's one of these:
SQL Server 2012 Express Management Studio (x64) - (English)
SQL Server 2012 Express Edition with Tools (x64) - (English)
SQL Server 2012 Express Edition with Advanced Services (x64) - (English)
SQL Server 2012 Express (x64) - (English)

Ammad

Category :
Description :
Hi

  As a part of a CMA Strategy project we are going to compare SQL query performance in SQL Server 2008 and in SQL Server 2012.

I would require two Vms of the same configuration except that VM1 should have SQL Server 2008 and the other one should have SQL Server 2012. This will help us compare our loaders or SQL operations apples to apples.

Please let me know if there is any specific process for requesting such Vms other than e-mail and I would be more than happy to do so.

Thanks
S.Sanjay
--

From: Zhou, Cheng Sent: Monday, July 16, 2012 11:05 AM To: Sager, Ivan Cc: Jilani, Ammad Subject: Re: Fogbugz
Hey Ivan, We do have BugMonkey in our FB installation so I think it's probably a relatively simple thing to get this installed. I think we just need to setup a process to install this in staging and make sure that it works and doesn't mess up anything before we roll it into production. I do know that the DevOps folks are fairly busy at the moment, but if you send a request to crimsondevit and talk to Ammad, it's probably something that could be done without a huge amount of effort.
Thanks, Ez
-- Cheng Zhou The Advisory Board Crimson zhouc@advisory.com +1512.377.1942 Ph | +1512.795.4356 M

case.sLatestTextSummary: fogbugz/kiln doesn't force https We need to be forcing https for security reasons… You can do that using a rewrite module Here's an example: http://learn.iis.net/page.aspx/461/creating-rewrite-rules-for-the-url-rewrite-module/ If you open a ...

event.s:
fogbugz/kiln doesn't force https
We need to be forcing https for security reasons… You can do that using a rewrite module Here's an example: http://learn.iis.net/page.aspx/461/creating-rewrite-rules-for-the-url-rewrite-module/
If you open a browser and go to http://fogbugz.devid.local it runs over http and does not re-direct to https. That's not good.
Note: test in IE, Firefox, Chrome and Safari, as some of them do the redirect and some don't.
event.sHtml:
fogbugz/kiln doesn't force https

We need to be forcing https for security reasons… You can do that using a rewrite module
Here's an example: http://learn.iis.net/page.aspx/461/creating-rewrite-rules-for-the-url-rewrite-module/

If you open a browser and go to http://fogbugz.devid.local it runs over http and does not re-direct to https. That's not good.

Note: test in IE, Firefox, Chrome and Safari, as some of them do the redirect and some don't.

case.sTitle: Missing Postload from SVN for Member St Tammany

event.s:
FW: Missing Postload from SVN for Member St Tammany Description Conversations New Problem Associate Change
From: Kumar, Rishi Sent: Monday, August 06, 2012 6:05 PM To: Chirco, Keith Cc: Kumar, Rishi; Beebe, Jeff Subject: Missing Postload from SVN for Member St Tammany
Hi Keith,
After following up with CDA Support and the IT Infrastructure team (Luis/Chase), I was kindly referred to you. This is of a relatively high importance since it’s impacting ongoing loads with a current member and hope you can assist me.
Here’s the background: Jeff Beebe from the CMA BA team and myself (CCC BA) discovered in early June (around 6/12/2012) that the SVN folder for St Tammany – which included the CCC and CMA SQL we had created and maintain for recurring data loads – was missing. We tried finding it in the SVN trunk to no avail.
Here’s the problem – the updated SQL needed for CMA was on someone’s local machine, but the updated SQL I need for CCC was not. I had made a lot of updates after doing a Member Onsite to these SQL files. Losing those files means a lot of lost time.
Can you please check to see:
a) If you can recover the SQL for St Tammany we’re talking about? And
b) See why/how this happened? I think it would be prudent of us to identify why this happened so we can avoid it in the future.
My biggest concern is how can we even delete from the trunk of Subversion? I don’t know how – do we have rights too? Also, my apologies if this doesn’t fall under your domain, but I’ve been passed from one person to the next, so if you could help me or point me to the right person that too would be very appreciated.
Huge thanks ahead of time,
Rishi Kumar Associate Director, Performance Technologies The Advisory Board Company 512-623-7176 direct | 512-609-1150 fax kumarr@advisory.com | www.advisory.com

Here’s the problem – the updated SQL needed for CMA was on someone’s local machine, but the updated SQL I need for CCC was not.  I had made a lot of updates after doing a Member Onsite to these SQL files.  Losing those files means a lot of lost time.
 
Can you please check to see:

event.s:
Hi Ammad,
The instructions for activating the terminal service licensing service on Windows 2008 can be viewed on this site. I’ve done this myself before, and the instructions look right from the link. http://www.techotopia.com/index.php/Configuring_a_Windows_Server_2008_Terminal_Services_License_Server
Once activated, we have 60 days grace period to add a license pack to activate this. Before then, we can use terminal services as is. We will provide you with a licensing pack before the 60 expiration, when we get a chance to contact the clearing house call center/find online license packs in MSDN.
Zheng
event.sHtml:
Hi Ammad,
 
The instructions for activating the terminal service licensing service on Windows 2008 can be viewed on this site.  I’ve done this myself before, and the instructions look right from the link.
http://www.techotopia.com/index.php/Configuring_a_Windows_Server_2008_Terminal_Services_License_Server
 
Once activated, we have 60 days grace period to add a license pack to activate this.  Before then, we can use terminal services as is.
We will provide you with a licensing pack before the 60 expiration, when we get a chance to contact the clearing house call center/find online license packs in MSDN.

Zheng

case.sLatestTextSummary: Hi, SiteManager relies on the “Web Deploy Agent Service”. After patching over the weekend, this service to failed to restart. Which is weird, because it was configured to automatically start. Luis mentioned that we have some software that can ...

event.s:
Hi,
SiteManager relies on the “Web Deploy Agent Service”. After patching over the weekend, this service to failed to restart. Which is weird, because it was configured to automatically start.
Luis mentioned that we have some software that can check windows services on various servers and ensure they are running. Can we please get that running for all of the dev application servers?
Please let me know if you have any questions. Priority is not deathly urgent.
Thanks,
Brock *******************************************
Brock,
I just gained access to the Dev Nagios server monitor. This is already setup on many of the servers but a little out of date with the rapid pace of changes. DevOps will be meeting later this week to discuss which servers and services to monitor and which are critical. We'll follow up with you next week.
Thank you, Matt
event.sHtml:
Hi,
 
SiteManager relies on the “Web Deploy Agent Service”.  After patching over the weekend, this service to failed to restart.  Which is weird, because it was configured to automatically start.
 
Luis mentioned that we have some software that can check windows services on various servers and ensure they are running.  Can we please get that running for all of the dev application servers?
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.  Priority is not deathly urgent.
 
Thanks,
 
Brock
*******************************************

Brock,

I just gained access to the Dev Nagios server monitor.  This is already setup on many of the servers but a little out of date with the rapid pace of changes.  DevOps will be meeting later this week to discuss which servers and services to monitor and which are critical.  We'll follow up with you next week.

Thank you,
Matt
